text.p: An earthquake measuring 5.1 on the Richter scale rocked southwest China on Saturday, the Xinhua news agency said.
It was not immediately known if there were any casualties or damages from the earthquake which hit Jinghong in Yunnan province at 10:38 a.m. (0238 GMT).
The epicentre was at 21.9 degrees north latitude and 101.1 degrees east longitude, Xinhua said.
Inhabitants in Jinghong city and Menghai county felt the temblor, it said, adding that an unknown number of houses in neighbouring Mengla county were damaged.
The Yunnan provincial Seismological Bureau had sent a team to the area to carry out work and investigate damages and casualties, Xinhua said. It gave no further details.
